NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper and Blackwell architectures use NVLink-C2C, allowing CPU-GPU memory sharing. This innovation enhances data access and…

item.title: Accelerate Large-Scale LLM Inference and KV Cache Offload with CPU-GPU Memory Sharing
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) like Llama 3 70B and Llama 4 Scout 109B face challenges with inference due to their size. These models can require significant memory, often exceeding GPU limits, especially with large context windows. The NVIDIA Grace architectures address this by utilizing NVLink C2C, allowing CPU and GPU to share memory efficiently. This setup enhances the processing of large datasets and enables quicker access, minimizing the risk of out-of-memory errors during inference….

item.title: Accelerate Large-Scale LLM Inference and KV Cache Offload with CPU-GPU Memory Sharing
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) like Llama 3 and Llama 4 are pushing AI boundaries, but their size poses challenges for inference efficiency. These models can require substantial GPU memory, often leading to out-of-memory errors during inference. The NVIDIA Grace architectures address this with NVLink C2C, offering a high-bandwidth connection that shares CPU and GPU memory. item.title: About
item.description:
About Daily Tech Articles Feed

Welcome to Daily Tech Articles Feed ‚Äì your centralized hub for staying up-to-date with the latest developments in technology and software development.

What We Do

This site aggregates and summarizes RSS feeds from top IT blogs and technology publications, bringing you curated content from across the tech industry in one convenient location.

Key Features

  • üîÑ Daily Updates: Fresh content aggregated daily from leading tech sources
  • üìä Smart Categorization: Articles automatically organized by technology topics and categories
  • üîç Easy Filtering: Browse by specific categories or sources to find exactly what interests you
  • üì± Mobile-Friendly: Optimized reading experience on all devices
  • ‚ö° Fast & Clean: Lightweight design focused on content consumption

Our Sources

We monitor RSS feeds from:
